measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Access to care: My patients are able to receive services without excessive travel"
justification: Table 1 lists the survey item “Access to care: My patients are able to receive services without excessive travel,” indicating this value was operationalised through that specific item in the values-ranking survey.

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Accuracy: My patients' test results are correct and devices are fit to prescriptive targets"
justification: In Table 1 the authors include the statement “Accuracy: My patients' test results are correct and devices are fit to prescriptive targets,” showing that the construct ‘Accuracy’ was measured via this survey item.

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Comfort: The physical fit of devices does not cause pain"
justification: The survey instrument lists the item “Comfort: The physical fit of devices does not cause pain,” demonstrating how the construct ‘Comfort’ was assessed.

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Cost: My patients find the price of my products and services acceptable"
justification: Table 1 contains the item “Cost: My patients find the price of my products and services acceptable,” indicating that ‘Cost’ was measured through this survey statement.

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Design: The style and aesthetics of devices are important"
justification: The construct ‘Design’ appears in the survey as “Design: The style and aesthetics of devices are important,” showing its measurement within the ranking task.

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Ease of use: My patients receive the training to use their devices independently"
justification: The authors specify the survey item “Ease of use: My patients receive the training to use their devices independently,” which is how the value ‘Ease of use’ was captured.

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Efficiency: The time invested by me and my patient is used effectively"
justification: Table 1 includes “Efficiency: The time invested by me and my patient is used effectively,” indicating measurement of the ‘Efficiency’ construct.

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Equity: I treat all patients with dignity and respect despite personal differences"
justification: The construct ‘Equity’ is operationalised through the survey statement “I treat all patients with dignity and respect despite personal differences,” as listed in Table 1.

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Evidence-based: My professional activities are supported by scientific research"
justification: The survey measures the ‘Evidence-based’ value via the item “Evidence-based: My professional activities are supported by scientific research.”

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Health: I refer patients for disorders requiring medical intervention"
justification: Later in the methods the authors cite the item “Health: I refer patients for disorders requiring medical intervention,” showing how the ‘Health’ value was assessed.

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Objective benefit: Results from aided testing or audibility indices indicate patient benefit"
justification: The instrument includes “Objective benefit: Results from aided testing or audibility indices indicate patient benefit,” which operationalises the construct ‘Objective benefit.’

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Privacy: I protect my patients' health information and other private data"
justification: The study lists the statement “Privacy: I protect my patients' health information and other private data,” indicating measurement of the ‘Privacy’ value.

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Professional duties: I adhere to standards of conduct and codes of ethics in my field"
justification: ‘Professional duties’ is measured through the survey item “I adhere to standards of conduct and codes of ethics in my field,” as described in the survey materials.

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Safety: I do not cause harm to my patients through device settings or physical interactions"
justification: Table 1 shows the item “Safety: I do not cause harm to my patients through device settings or physical interactions,” demonstrating how the ‘Safety’ construct was measured.

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Satisfaction: My patients find that devices and services meet their expectations"
justification: The survey includes “Satisfaction: My patients find that devices and services meet their expectations,” which serves as the measure for the ‘Satisfaction’ value.

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Self-efficacy: My patients can overcome the challenges imposed by their hearing ability"
justification: The construct ‘Self-efficacy’ is assessed via the survey statement “Self-efficacy: My patients can overcome the challenges imposed by their hearing ability.”

measured_by: Values-ranking survey item "Subjective benefit: Results from questionnaires or self-report indicate patient benefit"
justification: The item “Subjective benefit: Results from questionnaires or self-report indicate patient benefit” illustrates how the ‘Subjective benefit’ value was measured in the survey.
